term.title: diamond

item.text: An allotropic form of the element carbon with cubic structure (space group O h 7- F d 3 m) which is thermodynamically stable at pressures above 6 GPa at room temperature and metastable at atmospheric pressure. At low pressures diamond converts rapidly to graphite at temperatures above 1900 K in an inert atmosphere. The chemical bonding between the carbon atoms is covalent with sp3hybridization.

notes.item: There is also a hexagonal diamond-like structure of the element carbon (lonsdaleite).

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 487 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
